column5: Hey all.  I was wondering if there is a way I can make my clam 2000 hut a little bit stronger in the wind department.  I ask as it's getting some wear marks and the wind is coming through (lightly) in spots.  Is there something I can use to coat it and not do more damage to either the inside or outside?  Thanks.  Geoff
I don't own a hut but I'd bet that iron on patches would do the trick.  When I was a kid I tore every pants playing every sport growing up.  Mom's solution?  Iron on patch!  Durable & waterproof heh.

A backing stove,a pot and some soup and 2 bowls.That cured it last weekend.I have the same a never treated it.When the sun is high it will warm the fabric and you up.As for the wind to go threw the fabric,I prefer it.Esp when I get the stove going.
